多
Facebook's e-commerce strategy continues to take shape. Shops help build awareness for SMBs and move them down the funnel, while Pay reduces friction & creates a more seamless checkout process. Messaging also enables SMBs to communicate directly w/customers and provide support. While still early, the company stated it is already scaling FB Shops quickly as brick & mortar businesses create digital storefronts seamlessly. Meanwhile, FB is working to expand its payment options through FB Pay, WhatsApp Pay (likely longer-term due to regulatory hurdles), and Checkout. FB also emphasized the importance of messaging commerce & click to messaging ads, the latter of which have exceeded expectations. Messaging commerce is especially important in developing countries, where SMBs conduct transactions over Messenger and WhatsApp, & it also helps to improve customer service. We note that WhatsApp Business now has 50M+ users, and there are now 180M+ businesses that use FB’s tools every month vs. 160M in May. While there are 5% fees tied to transactions through Checkout, FB indicated that bigger monetization impact over time would come from incremental ad dollars as FB drives more conversions. At 180M biz using FB tools & 9M advertisers, 5% penetration suggests considerable room ahead.
